meanings.definition: The state of having a physical body.
meanings.sent1: Her corporality was evident in the way she moved with grace and strength.
meanings.sent2: The doctor studied the corporality of the patient's injuries to determine the best treatment.
meanings.sent3: The corporality of the situation hit him when he accidentally bumped into the wall.
meanings.sent4: In the world of dreams, his corporality seemed to fade away into the mist.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of corporality in his sculpture, making it seem almost lifelike.

meanings.definition: The quality of being physical or tangible.
meanings.sent1: The corporality of the rock made it difficult to move without help.
meanings.sent2: The scientist marveled at the corporality of the experiment's results.
meanings.sent3: The corporality of the cake was undeniable as it sat on the table, tempting everyone.
meanings.sent4: His words had a corporality to them, as if they could be touched and felt.
meanings.sent5: The corporality of the mountain range took his breath away as he stood at the summit.
